question.body: In your own words explain why some experts recommend that you should breath through your nose when temperatures are low.

part.explanation: When the temperature of the air is very cold it can cause damage to the respiratory zone. It can also lead to lower enzyme function which can decrease the ability of the body to convert between carbon dioxide and carbonic acid. Breathing in through the nose is advantageous because the nasal cavity contains the nasal conchae which help to warm and humidify the cold air before it enters the trachea. The nostrils are also smaller in diameter so less air can enter and be warmed at one time.
